result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:05 AM Defendant Michael P King in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
State moves to dimiss and read into cases 22CF393 and 22CF394
Defense does not object. 
Court dismisses and reads into cases 22CF393 and 22CF394

Any monies posted on this matter to be applied to fine/fee/surcharges in 22CF394
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter dated 08-05-2022 received and filed.
Plea hearing on August 8, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Case called at 2:03 PM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Michael P King in court with attorney Eryn M Menden. 
Attorney Menden requests a different date for a plea hearing.  Court grants.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

09:24 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Michael P King in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   
Atty. Menden updates the court on this matter and requests a plea hearing date in about 45 days.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter dated 05-20-2022, received and filed.

10:21 AM  Defendant Michael P King in court by zoom video with attorney Ricardo Tapia for attorney Eryn M Menden.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Eryn Menden appointed counsel by Public Defender's Office
Preliminary hearing on April 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  The defendant is ordered drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

01:40 PM Defendant Michael P King in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
